website_summaries.verdict: The Acer Chromebook 13 is on the cutting edge, with an Nvidia Tegra K1 processor, advanced gaming support, and a 13-inch full HD display. But even with all these advancements, it doesn't seem much better than most of the competition.
pros: New Nvidia Tegra K1 promises WebGL and Unity 5 3D capability
cons: White plastic chassis shows every scuff and smudge
Few Chrome games take advantage of new capabilities

customer_reviews.title: Worst chromebook I have and I have used 4 other types!
customer_reviews.text: This chromebook was hyped to be fast but the processor is so slow the computer freezes up. Wifi is shabby too. I went and did research on it after to see if it was an external issue but other reviews and help sites also mentioned similar issues with this specific model. I would not recommend this chromebook to anyone, even for basic surfing and google docs work. If you have more than 8 tabs open it is slow and you have to wait like it was windows all over again. Original chromebooks by Acer were very good machines now they seem to cut costs on quality even with all the so called upgrades.
customer_reviews.author: BenF

customer_reviews.title: It's extremely useful for any homework need as it has all the ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 of these Chromebooks for our high school aged kids for doing homework and assignments. It's extremely useful for any homework need as it has all the productivity of Google Docs and works extremely well with all the school's site like TurnItIn and MyBigCampus. The offer for 1TB Google Drive storage for 2 years is almost worth the cost of the Chromebook itself. The Tegra K1 inside is snappy and quick. It's a pleasant desktop browser experience!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Power To The People!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think it was possible but after 1 month of use, this has now become my go-to computer. Now both my MS Windows run laptops and my big honking desktop are now gathering dust while I use this on a daily basis for everything. Google is my life long companion now as it allows me to work with all my pictures, files, and documents easily. I also like the fact that some of the other Google apps like KEEP work seemlessly between this and my smartphone! GOOGLE - Power To The People!
customer_reviews.author: Cautious Consumer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Chromebook. It has never failed me. The batter is life is great even after 2 years. The screen looks good. The entire unit is light and everything just works. It is not fancy and If I happen to loose it break it or spill a drink on it I won't cry because I just toasted my $1500 computer. I will rock it till it dies and then I will buy the fancy new Chromebook with a touch screen. As for ruggedness, this has been dropped, lightly stepped on, carried in backpacks and skied with. It has held up with no marks or bruises.
customer_reviews.author: sam h.

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!!!!  LOVE  <3 <3 <3
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind, I'm a dilettante computer user. I don't edit anything, trade stocks or do anything of particular importance on this. Essentially I use this for shopping, browsing Reddit (shoutout!) or Youtube. That being said, compared to my Macbook Air that I now realized I overpaid for, this feels about the same and I literally paid a small fraction of the price. I like the white look, very clean and it matches my phone. Speed is fast, looks great, battery lasts forever so far and it's super cheap, what more can a girl ask for?! :) Super satisfied. I almost feel like I stole this thing, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Fi Ona

customer_reviews.title: Good Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Good lightweight chromebook. Highres screen, light, super fast boot, and long battery life. It does slow down when using flash game sites or using more than 10 browser tabs at the same time. I love the long battery life. On weekends I use it throughout the day while watching tv and find that it last the entire day. That was never possible using my old windows laptop. Chromebooks are good for online tasks and simple documents using google docs, but won't run windows programs. I knew that ahead of time but sometimes find myself wishing I could. Overall this is a good Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: A Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook is fantastic! Battery life is as good as advertised; I get 10-11 hours out of this device while running on battery, with nearly constant internet access, a lot of YouTube videos, and accessing Chrome Remote Desktop. The screen isn't the largest I've had on a laptop but its big enough to easily read what's on screen, and its really nice having a laptop with a 1080p screen. The processor is fast enough to do everything a chromebook can handle, and the computer runs silently due to it being fanless, which is a big plus. The built in speakers are not that great, however this device has Bluetooth built-in, which I wasn't even aware of when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Smith

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE:  1/1/19  hat the _tf...
customer_reviews.text: The update is that the double U. key is failing. It's been a good computer but sadly the keyboard is failing. This is my second Acer that has experienced the same issue ith the same key. Very disappointing. I had the previous version of Acer Chromebook and loved it. The speed, weight, and picture of that version was terrific. This one seems to bog down and has extremely small font that must be adjusted on every page. I got it for a great price and it's good enough. Hoping for a patch that corrects these issues but I'm not optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: 1 minor issue is MAJOR
customer_reviews.text: this chromebook will NOT hold a charge. it will charge when plugged in and you can use it if you leave it plugged in, but as soon as you unplug the charger, it powers down and when you restart, it has closed/lost everything you've done. when i looked up the issue online, i read that this is common and the only resolution is to send the unit back to Acer...which I am looking into. sadly, i loved everything else about it, but it is kind of pointless to have a netbook/laptop if you have to stay plugged in...
customer_reviews.author: thejuniorscoutTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook.
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful Chromebook with a very long battery life. Specifically, when compared to the HP Chromebook 14 with the same Tegra K1 processor: * This screen has better resolution than most of the HP models. * It is clocked slightly slower, resulting in slightly lower benchmarks. I could not observe the difference doing actual work. * It has a better battery life. I've been using it bedside and only charging it every few nights. Weak spot: the charger plugin looks very cheap. I would be nervous lending this unit with the charger to small children.
customer_reviews.author: Asomicait

customer_reviews.title: Full HD monitor and 4K external resolution support. Good value for money.
customer_reviews.text: excellent device for the price. Runs reasonably smoothly, keyboard and trackpad have decent quality, the full HDMI port is mechanically robust can drive a 4K/30Hz screen. Re. the software, despite being an ARM processor, 'developer' features such as crouton (linux chroot environments) and even the android emulation do work. I own 3 other chromebooks and i consider this at least on par with the Acer C720 (best of the low cost ones) and much better than the Lenovo N20P or the old Arm chromebook. On the negative side, the power supply connector seems extremely weak and prone to break, and the white color of the case is not going to last long.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Check the details before ordering this laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I must have ordered this laptop and missed the important details. This is not a touch screen. This will do no gaming. It is only good for internet usage and camera use such as videos chats or YouTube. The kids like it but wish there was more to this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, i would suggest to anyone needing to ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife was complaining that her old laptop(Windows 7 Starter) was slow so i took a gamble on this Chromebook and she loves it. Her only complaint was the solid white color. But i was able to find a snap-on hard case in the color she wanted. Great buy, i would suggest to anyone needing to check email/online shopping.. Found one weird issue with the keyboard. Its like a standard QWERTY board but there is no caps lock
customer_reviews.author: Preston j. Conner III

customer_reviews.title: The sleep/wake function is great. The response is quick when it is turned ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband. I use it mostly. The sleep/wake function is great. The response is quick when it is turned on. Definately seems like a fancier laptop than an inexpensive Chromebook. This is the 2nd Chromebook in our house. I have to say we really like these. The are fast, do not have to worry about bloatware and are very lightweight. If you are familiar with the Google suite of online tools you will love this. We have found that plug ins and other required apps for PCs can be challenging as this is more of an internet computing device. We love it and see the value of it. Would definitely buy another
customer_reviews.author: Hima50

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Acer Chromebook 13 for about a week. First time working with Googles operating system but it's intuitive & user friendly. My current needs are fast Internet & small amount of space for saving resume, cover letters and various word processing, spreadsheets, etc. This is perfect for what I needed. Fast...FAST and 100GB cloud storage for 2 years...no bloat ware or unnecessary add-ons bogging down the speed. In a thin, light laptop design I can toss in my purse & not even notice! All for under $200?? So far...I'm beyond happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: JLeggo

customer_reviews.title: Grainy display kills an otherwise stunning Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: The DISPLAY on this ACER Chromebook should be updated and the current crappy screen should be wiped out. It's grainy and my wife requires glasses to see it. We have two (2) 15" ACER Chromebooks that don't suck in their displays. This one is notably grainy and text is polluted with a lack of clarity. Review it for yourself on Google and make sure you search for the ACER model. A sad choice for ACER which could easily have blown away this market with a Chromebook that really showed what you could do.
customer_reviews.author: Utah

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine for about 6 months but slowly started to have ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for about 6 months but slowly started to have an issues where it would not charge unless it was flipped open. Eventually, it would not hold a charge at all. After a little over a year I've had to replace it. I like Chromebooks but this particular one was not of great quality. Maybe I got a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very light and fast.
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine. I have a regular laptop but find that I use this most of the time because it is lighter, starts up and shuts down faster, and is so much more efficient to use. If you mostly use your computer to surf the internet or do online shopping, this is way better, cheaper, and faster than a regular laptop with Wi***** on it. Oh -- and read the basic guide on how to use it. I noticed some people complain in their reviews that the keyboard doesn't do certain things -- that's not true -- it does everything you need. Read the short guide so you don't make the same uninformed mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about this Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this Chromebook! My favorite feature is the HDMI output. I can connect it to my tv's hdmi and watch everything through this device to my tv which is awesome! The battery life is also incredible. It says it has a 10-12hr battery life, that's if you're using it nonstop maybe. I've gone a couple days, using it intermittently before the battery needed charged. After all the shopping around and research I put in to buying the best Chromebook (for my price range), I believe this is it, especially for the price and HD. It feels well made and functions great with both Logitech wireless mouse and keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: This is a FANTASTIC Chromebook! The battery life is well over 11 hours and it is super fast. This computer is fantastic for school work and charges very quickly. The speakers are very loud, which is surprising because the speakers are located underneath. Honestly this chromebook is pretty sweet and for right around 200 dollars its a great buy. It's pretty nice for the price and the quality that this chromebook gives. Acer did a good job with this one.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: I mean after 3 years of use, still good and going strong after daily use!
customer_reviews.text: Brought this as a school computer and worked really well, the battery ended up dying and had to spend 10 dollars on a replacement one. I mean after 3 years of use still good and running strong, hasn't slowed down, very happy and would purchase again, if i needed a school computer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for web, and class.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful machine, I wish I never waited to get one. Battery lasts forever. I use my schools wifi and store everything in the drive, and can access everything from my google account, the age of the flash drive has disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Farrell

customer_reviews.title: ... (and probably won't be my last) and I'm very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Chromebook (and probably won't be my last) and I'm very pleased with it. It is not a substitute for my notebook but something I take with me when I want to travel light. I use it for surfing the net, email and word processing with Google Docs. I have no complaints about it except that the touchpad can be a bit sensitive but I attribute that to the fact that I've never used one and need some time getting used to it. There are a good number of naysayers about Chromebooks but I"m not among them. For basic computing, this is a great device for at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Battery life has been a disappointment with just about every device I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Found the default display setting of 1920x1080 to be a bit difficult to read, switched it to 1200x675 and find it to be much more clear. Battery life has been a disappointment with just about every device I've ever owned, but not this. Ran it on battery for 8 hours and the meter showed 70% full. Boot up time is lightening fast and you can set security so you don't have to enter the password if one of your android devices are unlocked and in range.
customer_reviews.author: mjsullivan

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased 20 of these items for my classroom ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 20 of these items for my classroom. Over half of them have stopped working: screen is black and unit will not charge. I have gotten them repaired, but it costs $17 to send them to the ACER repair in Texas. The repair service is speedy and only takes a couple of days, but why are they all dying right after the 12-month warranty is up? If you buy one of these, chances are you will have to spend $20 to mail it to Texas to get it repaired. Since the unit was only $150, I guess it was worth it?
customer_reviews.author: Rekern

customer_reviews.title: High school student on the go.
customer_reviews.text: I go to school full time and participate in activities regularly, this laptop has helped me with everything from writing papers all the way to watching videos and movies on long road trips. I looked at most the specs in the reviews and already knew it wasn't made for gaming but, was powerful enough to last me for some years, i've used it for about 5 days with only charging two days out of that. All in all to keep you guys from dying reading a book I could type, I would say this is a 5 out of 5 no fan, incredible boot up time, great screen, great sound, and overwhelming performance.
customer_reviews.author: Guy named Byrd

customer_reviews.title: I Love My Acer Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. Very easy to setup. Wifi is excellent, Netflix runs flawlessly. Screen is plenty bright enough, it comes with the brightness at about 1/2 setting so until you figure that out it appears duller than what we expect. The keyboard is really nice, no chatter, soft touch. The pad for navigating the screen is quite easy to use and very responsive and you can tailor it to your needs. Still have things to figure out like how do you drag something around the screen (my inexperience showing). On this day I would buy it again and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gear

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Support Most VPNs
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality and good functionality, but Google somewhat arrogantly claims that PPTP is too insecure to include on a security-focused device like the Chromebook. Most workplace VPNs, commercial VPN services, and home routers that offer VPN host capability (e.g. Asus) are PPTP host devices. Don't buy if you need to access the most common types of VPNs on a regular basis. Other than that...I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe W

customer_reviews.title: The only thing better about this is that the screen is bigger
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my ASUS C720 broke. The only thing better about this is that the screen is bigger. GIFs and videos load super slow. If I have more than three tabs of videos loading or paused, the screen goes black and Chrome restarts. Sometimes this happens if a PDF file is too large or if I have too many extensions turned on (as in more than 5). This never happened with my ASUS. Pretty disappointed tbh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Appealing specs, terrible performance.
customer_reviews.text: Got this chromebook as a replacement for an old laptop, but it is just as slow. The build material feels and looks good, the screen resolution is 1080p, touchpad is good, and it has ac wifi. However, I found this chromebook lagging and freezing frequently, most likely due to the useless 2gb ram (which is used up quickly by chrome), and tegra k1 processor. In addition, despite its 1080p resolution, youtube videos struggle to play correctly, stuttering/buffering forever when set to 1080p/60fps. I always have to lower the video quality/resolution, rendering a 1080p resolution meaningless. My internet connection/speed are considered good in the US, so all of the problems are due to this chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: EN

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: An excellent little laptop. Performance is good. Battery life really is amazing, and the battery takes eons to drain when it's turned off. The large screen resolution is helpful to fit a lot on screen with good detail, although it's slightly high for such a physically small screen. The screen quality isn't that awesome; the matt finish (I'm used to glossy screens) looks slightly grainy when displaying a pure white image (e.g. a website background), and the viewing angle isn't the best out there, but you get used to it pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Warren

customer_reviews.title: wanted to see what it was all about as I am already pretty invested in the Google ecosystem
customer_reviews.text: My first Chromebook, wanted to see what it was all about as I am already pretty invested in the Google ecosystem. I quite like it, I think it will handle 99% of my day to day computing needs Items was second hand, demo stock I believe (as was advertised) and it was exactly as described, new condition with a previously opened packaging. would definitely buy from this seller again. As always, delivery outside the US slower and more expensive than it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Chan

customer_reviews.title: The Acer Chromebook 13 is a buy!
customer_reviews.text: I like the new increased screen resolution. When I first decided to purchase, I was worried about the increased size as I previously used a 11 in Samsung series 3. This concern has proved to be unfounded. It is not too heavy to transport in my backpack. I like the good increased battery life. The only factor that might improve the experience is the fact that the charger is the same size and weight as the older Samsung. But most often because of increased battery life, I can leave the charger at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and used 0 of the programs except maybe Picasa and word and easy stuff, and it was getting old and time ...
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for mom. She had a cheap laptop previously, and used 0 of the programs except maybe Picasa and Word and easy stuff, and it was getting old and time to change. She loves it. Shes up til 11:30 on work nights playing words with friends. The speed is noticeably great, even for someone who's not tech savvy, so it definitely takes away from that impatience of waiting for things to load. Screen quality is good for someone who doesn't really care, and the matte screen is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook & Tegra for the win
customer_reviews.text: This is my main device for my home computing needs now. My Windows laptop has been all but retired since I got this about a month ago. Glad I got the one with 4 gigs of ram & 32 gig hard drive. The Tegra processor is solid & battery life is excellent. I watch a lot of videos on it & it still gets me at least 9 hours of battery life with heavy video watching. The only thing I can say that I wish was better is the viewing angles of the screen. It has a narrow angle of visibility, but I have adjusted to it now.
customer_reviews.author: T. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and close to an information appliance
customer_reviews.text: Not as fast as my other Chromebook, an Acer C720 but not so slow as to be a problem. The display is Ok but the keyboard spacing and extra screen real estate are very useful. The battery life is also noticeably better than the C720 which isn't shabby either. The machine is pleasant to look at and reminds me to some extent of an older white Apple Macbook that I own. Chome OS is definitely a win from a security perspective. Hopefully Google will be able to resist government agencies trying to compromise Chrome's inherent built-in security.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer Geek

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chromebook thinking it was going to be a good one, I received it later than I should of, 3 days later to be exact. When I finally got it delivered the box was beaten up bad which wasn't a problem,there was minimum scratches on keyboard which I didn't care for it worked great, I had charged fully and I kept wanting to download apps but it never let me, and it died at 29%, will not be purchasing again. I'm very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Ana B.

customer_reviews.title: but the cord is very long and I really like that. It has more USB ports than my ...
customer_reviews.text: I also have an HP Chromebook. This screen is much larger. The charger is not the normal mini USB of my other devices, but the cord is very long and I really like that. It has more USB ports than my other device, although I'm not using them at this point. The battery life is awesome. Much longer than my other device. This is very nice. I use it with a wireless mouse and headphones, and use it mostly when I'm in bed. I enjoy the Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a great chromebook for the price. It is difficult for someone who is used to using a regular laptop to get used to not being able to download certain programs but rather get used to the google based programs. One thing that is frustrating is loading your music to it and then being able to get to it or for example adding pictures and then uploading them to facebook....just takes some time to get used to it. Hopefully Google will get rid of Google + and make their apps more seamless.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal M. Simonelli

customer_reviews.title: Great Build from Acer, impressed with the Google Chrome OS!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the chromebook from acer. The most important features for me were a solid keyboard and long battery life. Acer's option was the best choice for me. It feels like a premium laptop for a great price. My use for this machine is as a portable second laptop for working from home or in bed. I am able to do pretty much everything I want on this thing. I even sideload a few android apps for MS Lync, and proxy my http traffic to my corporate network using my main machine as a proxy server. I have the 4gb 32gb version.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Great for those on the go or light users with
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my fiance for work. She needed a laptop for business use but all job requires is office suit email and web applications. This was perfect. Super fast and light to carry very convenient for those who don't quite need full functionality of a laptop/pc or maybe those people that are lucky to be able to know how To use apps .. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Mugs

customer_reviews.title: Pleased so far with this machine.
customer_reviews.text: Came in just two days. Was well packed. I am well satisfied with the unit. Display looks good. Seems fast enough for me. The only thing I find that I don't like too much is the touch pad as sometimes it is very sensitive and other times it not so at all. I can though use a USB mouse instead which works very well. I'm getting used to the Chrome Operating System and am beginning to be very comfortable with using the machine. The machine seems to be well constructed and battery life I think will be very satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R. King

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop!
customer_reviews.text: It does everything I need. Storing all my files with the cloud is awesome. Chrome is great. It's very portable, thin, light. I love my chromebook. I have my home PC that does all my heavy work. It's easy to work between the Chromebook and PC. It's so fast, the screen is great. There isn't any negative that I can say about my Acer. It's everything I was expecting..I'm so happy I went with the Chromebook over Windows 8 laptop. In my opinion there is no comparison. I highly recommend getting a Chromebook if you want very fast access to the internet, no bloatware, great way to stream videos..It's pretty sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Darren M. Tooley

customer_reviews.title: Really simple computer, made for browsing internet and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Really simple computer, made for browsing internet and it kicks ass at it. I bought and returned two 400 dollar laptops with windows 8 because they ran so slow, this google chrome OS blows windows away with its internet speed. The different processor really makes a difference; youtube and porn stream at a very acceptable pace.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with communication and pleasant to deal with.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my kids for school. Very pleased with the service and was delivered in record time and earlier than specified. Very pleased indeed and seller kept in communication to ensure that I got the deal negotiated. Beautiful experience all round and the chrome books are going ok and loved by the kids. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Manny O

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for work as I needed nothing more than ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for work as I needed nothing more than internet and the basics of word online. In the 2 year I've owned it I have had to send it in for repairs for the same charging issue 4 times! Now just out of warranty guess what is a problem again? It is well kept, no abused and at least one of those fixes started acting up 2 weeks after it was returned from getting fixed. I'm now in the market for a new affordable computer for work and will not go near another acer computer with a 10-foot pole.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica D. Rawlings

customer_reviews.title: Nice laptop, flexible, good substitute for a tablet
customer_reviews.text: Purchased instead of an Android tablet. Very satisfied. Beautiful screen, good keyboard, very long battery life. Light, thin, and rigid -- not "floppy flexible" like so many other newer laptops. Would prefer a color other than white, but I can live with the white given the laptop's other fine features. Battery recharges fast. Google's web-based office suite works well. Nividia architecture is stable and fast. Bought on sale from Amazon, excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Olde Sidekick

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but still not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Died on me within a year. Battery doesn't hold charge. Ordered new battery. Turns out not battery problem. Laptop not sending/receiving power from the battery. Works on power cable only.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: The touchscreen is very bad
customer_reviews.text: In the first week was working good but after that the touch screen is very bad need to restart every time when the screen is shaking. I regret I bought this brand
customer_reviews.author: Layth

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great for a kids computer.
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great for a kids computer. Long battery life was very important to me. It does pretty well for battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Bejarano

customer_reviews.title: Quad-core not powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: Though it has a "quad-core" processor...I have problems playing video...and audio. It is best to be used as a "notepad" (and not a "notebook computer"). Probably better than a tablet that is within the same price range... Use your Chromebook offline  Access your files offline
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Overall a very nice looking, very fast chrome book
customer_reviews.text: Well, I decided to purchase this chrome book because of its affordable price and it's 1080p HD display. Overall a very nice looking, very fast chrome book, but I was disappointed at the display, it's not very good, it's actually one of the worst displays I have seen in any chrome book. I did return it, and ended up getting a Toshiba HD chrome book with IPS display, which is an excellent choice, although slightly slower than the Acer. But if you do want a beautiful 1080p screen, then I would seriously be considering the Toshiba instead of the Acer.
customer_reviews.author: EFREN GARCIA

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Its light Cheap and does all the basic net surfing I need. The battery life is amazing! I used to buy expensive Macs and will probably buy a macbook air for 6 times the cost of this laptop. It's sad that tech things are engineered to be useless after about two years but other than boycotting things we are going to continue to part with hard earned cash way earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Blueman

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: If you have a very strong wifi connection its proabably a good product. But it your signal at home is average then this might not be the product for you. I had this chromebook set up at my house around 25 feet from the modem and it couldn't maintain a steady connection. My Ipad did a way better job could even stream video further away.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: It does everything expected at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: For web browsing, YouTube videos, word processing etc... This does it all perfectly well and has very good battery life. ***If you expect more than that from a cheap Chromebook then you're looking in the wrong place.
customer_reviews.author: Obsidian

customer_reviews.title: not as good as it introduce
customer_reviews.text: will buy other product for daily use. it's not durable and very slow. will not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: wai kwok chong

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as acer chrome c720
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as acer chrome c720. I own both. This one freezes and becomes slow suddenly> battery life is good. I have not had a single complaint so far for c720 amazin acer product
customer_reviews.author: Raag

customer_reviews.title: I got this for my daughter and it works great when it works BUT I have had trouble with ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter and it works great when it works BUT I have had trouble with with pin for power since day one. It was loose right away. I took it to a local repair person and we both agreed there was a missing piece that made that whole slot loose. Pretty certain something was missed in QC. That was fixed but then pin never made consistent contact with power plug so have had intermittent power problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Rick mehler

customer_reviews.title: Handy size
customer_reviews.text: With so many computer apps and tasks being shifted from your local box to the cloud, a Chromebook makes great sense. This model is a handy size for a crowded work environment. Oddly, the much-touted NVIDIA Tegra K1 chipset is slower than the Celeron chipset found on the bigger display Chromebooks with the same amount of RAM.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite New Toy
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It is quick, easy to use, well built. I had it up and running 5 minutes after opening the box. The screen is not "muddy" or "washed out" as some reviewers complained. The free apps work well (huge selection). For less than $300 this is a bargain. The keyboard has a great feel.For windows users, there is now a free "word" app that I've found helpful.
customer_reviews.author: mark hauer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Does everything to suit my needs. You just have to rethink how you use a computer a little bit. If you're starting documents, spreadsheets, presentations, etc..l from scratch, this isn't a problem. Your old documents will need a little massaging to get them to work with the chrome apps. Get an external monitor...you'll be glad you spend the extra $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Careful shopper 315

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is GREAT! I have used it to stream content to my ChomeCast, for general web-surfing, email, etc -- all the things a chromebook is good for. It's the right size, and reasonably light-weight. It doesn't have the best screen, but its not bad, either.
customer_reviews.author: William Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Precisely what I wanted (mostly)
customer_reviews.text: This product is pretty much exactly what I expected. Amazing battery life, anemic performance (which is not all that noticeable under *most* circumstances), and excellent portability. I have one negative comment to make: the jack on the computer where you stick in the power cable seems to wiggle quite a lot. This may actually be a feature; I don't know. It's not like I read the manual. Maybe this is their way of trying to make it less likely to break? I look at it and I worry I already broke it, but it was like that from the start. /shrug
customer_reviews.author: J/A

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy and all one needs unless ....
customer_reviews.text: Unless your an engineer, accountant or programmer; this Computer is for you! Boot in 11 seconds, battery good for 11 hours, HDMI to your TV and watch Netflix, read books. No anti anything needed; no Spam, No Virus, No Malware. Soon everyone will have one, sorry HP, Dell, ......
customer_reviews.author: William E. Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the first ever chromebook I have bought and I am quite pleased with its performance and sleek looks. I bought a refurbished chromebook to save money but couldn't tell it was even used. Starts up fast, easy setup and easy to use out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Zack K.

customer_reviews.title: Acer makes a nice machine, but the chrome o s needs attention
customer_reviews.text: Acer makes a nice machine, but the chrome o s needs attention. The high screen resolution makes the app launcher, app shelf and bookmarks bar shrink in size making them difficult to read.The available solution is to reduce the screen resolution. Why buy a chromebook with high resolution?
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: Could use a better display
customer_reviews.text: If you splurge on the better memory it's a pretty good machine for a Chromebook. However it has one real flaw -- the screen. It is grainy and hard on the eyes. Despite the 1080p resolution it is most certainly not "bright and crisp."
customer_reviews.author: Review Man

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 48 hours and then it died
customer_reviews.text: I unpacked it on Saturday afternoon and by Monday evening it had stopped working. The screen went blank. Nothing. Couldn't turn it on, couldn't turn it off. I hope that this one is a fluke because I've ordered a replacement and am really hoping that I'll be able to say lots of nice things about it later. For now I'll give it one star because it did do what it's supposed to do: Browse the internet. But for only two days. Come on Acer, you can do better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Donald R. Leetz

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: The battery doesn't last hardly at all. It works if you plug it in, and it doesn't drain all that fast while you're using it, but it drains 24/7 and is dead after a few days of not being plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Korhal

customer_reviews.title: Reviews said it is easy to use and navigate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as he's computer 'not with it at all'. Reviews said it is easy to use and navigate, but even I have issues with it now and then. Certain areas are a little foggy. I share my emails with him but he only gets some of them, things like that. It's taken some time, but he uses it with fewer interruptions to me asking for help.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stricktly for the web browsing but the processing speed was terrible, took several minutes to open one page and the internet connection was not the problem....
customer_reviews.author: Nicole P. Rabanal

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is really fantastic, I think the os needs to be upgraded ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is really fantastic, I think the os needs to be upgraded to be configured to work with the Nvidia K1 as I notice a few unusual stutters with the key entry speed. However video runs smooth and seems to take advantage of the nvidia processor. The unit feels modern and the trackpad works great. The only downside I see is the somewhat limited viewing angle of the screen, I am always readjusting to get optimun angle.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing....
customer_reviews.text: I have had this Chromebook since December 2014. Yesterday I noticed a crack on one hinge. I called Acer support and was informed that it is still under warranty but they will not cover it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It's a chrome-book with all that entails. The Screen is much better than one might think and or hear in these reviews and I'm a finicky SOB. Solidly built, doesn't feel the least bit cheap and again, I'm a finicky SOB. Speed is OK, it'll do everything most anybody will ask of it and then some.
customer_reviews.author: BPDX

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with quality
customer_reviews.text: So far no real issues. Bought for my wife who isn't savvy with Chromebooks and so far no real problems one or two small issues that we had to jump on a Windows computer to figure out, but overall very impressed. Battery life is all day with intermittent use. or about 8 hours of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: MoBillyAla

customer_reviews.title: Great Screen and Form Factor and an Awesome Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for daughter and she has loved it. I've been very impressed with it as well. Can't honestly compare it to other chrome books, but I can say that the screen is bright and the processor is more than enough for light-duty use. For the money Amazon is asking, I don't see how you could go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sexton

customer_reviews.title: A chink in the aromor.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be the chink in the Acer armor. I've bought several Acer Chromebooks and they have all been rock solid. I've recommended them to others. But this one began to become an issue after only about 60 days. The battery gave up, the monitor has issues, the headphone jack has come apart and the AC plug has broken. I'll have to think twice before buying or recommending this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: MoTim

customer_reviews.title: but i enjoy my Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I am using my chromebook as my defacto only laptop now. There are some uses where I need to use my Mac or Windows PC due to the limitations of the chromebook, but i enjoy my Chromebook. The one thing about many of the chromebooks, the Nexus player and so on are they seem to be cheaply made or have that plastic cheap feel to them. NOt sure why that is and it's not a big deal, but others have noticed the "cheap" look and feel compared to other computers.
customer_reviews.author: PJAM3

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook but has some nuances
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chromebook but has some minor nuances. Pros: Great keyboard and touchpad Fast HD Screen looks great Cons: HD screen makes font very small Anti-glare on screen makes screen look weird Charging light and status light is right next to display and is distracting when device is on
customer_reviews.author: 10outof10

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat these laptops!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 80-year old mother, and she LOVES IT! She never used a computer before in her life and she's practically mastered the use of this Chromebook! She's happy to finally be a part of the 21st century!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Dead after a year
customer_reviews.text: Total junk. I bought it for my daughter for high school and she got one year out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Donata

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, I usually hit ctrl+ 3 time to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very dependable unit with no virus issues. Nice size, I usually hit ctrl+ 3 time to crank the screen size to 150% for my aging eyes. The HD is a nice added feature. A great value, I paid $199...
customer_reviews.author: RobertH

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, very fast and reliable, light and portable. I use this as a supplement to my home PC while away or somewhere else in the house, streaming movies with ease. Great for a student taking notes, very good build quality in the keyboard. All around an excellent product, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Will Tavares

customer_reviews.title: Great until it stopped charging...
customer_reviews.text: This was a great laptop until the power cord stopped charging it and the response from the seller was basically "oh well, you're past the 90 day warranty."
customer_reviews.author: zomg

customer_reviews.title: and it's perfect for that - she really doesn't need it for ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sister, and she loves it. She mainly does web surfing and social networking, and it's perfect for that - she really doesn't need it for anything else. So if that's your use requirement, this is an excellent inexpensive option. I expect a lot of people
customer_reviews.author: Ariadne011

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my first Chromebook.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is very good. I can see the screen outside well, much better than my wife's Acer Chromebook 11. My Wife and Brother who both own the Acer Chromebook 11 now wish they had an Acer 13. I like the extra 1 inch width and height than the Acer Chromebook 11. I left Windows for this PC and have not missed it one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Pallen

customer_reviews.title: I love it! The first one my roommate kept using ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Acer Chromebook! I love it! The first one my roommate kept using so I kept getting annoyed and just got a another one, a bigger one! LOL! I also bought a Dell laptop but I use this mostly because it loads up fast!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality+portability laptop
customer_reviews.text: Two years using it and dont regret it a bit. Battery still last long almost as new. Performance is very acceptable, is not a i7 but for internet surfing, netflix and cloud apps really do the works. The screen is crispy but the angle of view could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Simon E. Mijares P

customer_reviews.title: Other than that this thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Headphone jack broke a few days in, but still plays out of speakers. Other than that this thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Rees

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. It takes some time to get used to looking for apps instead of downloading programs. It is amazing how many apps are available. Beautiful color, extremely fast. Lightweight and a nice size. My daughter who has had a MAC BOOK for years can't believe how great this is for 1/5 the price:)
customer_reviews.author: bb148

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I could get it at a great price, but was very surprised by the quality of the build and great performance. What I like best is the battery life. I let it sleep for days and when I flip up the screen, I can start working instantly with hours of power at the ready.
customer_reviews.author: John Mello

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have several tabs open and it's running fine. It only chokes if you load up several gifs at the same time. Otherwise it generates very little heat and battery life looks to be over 5hrs
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Brin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to learn.
customer_reviews.text: Mom loves it! - Couldn't add much more say more - works exactly as it should. Never had tried Chrome OS before, but it is not at all difficult to learn the way around it, so it was easy to teach mom how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G

customer_reviews.title: but the 1080p screen might actually be a bad idea. There isn't really and DPI scaling
customer_reviews.text: This sounds crazy, but the 1080p screen might actually be a bad idea. There isn't really any DPI scaling, so everything is sharper but also smaller. I end up zooming all the pages to better fit the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rayburn

customer_reviews.title: A great problem free notebook for non-techies to use.
customer_reviews.text: Nice notebook for the mother-in-law. She uses it exclusively for email and web based programs. I thought it would be faster but it is just right for her.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M Feather

customer_reviews.title: The screen is a little dark and a bit fuzzy but it is HD and that makes my life so easy. Boots fast and the battery life is insa
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my daughter but I steal it constantly to remote desktop into work. The screen is a little dark and a bit fuzzy but it is HD and that makes my life so easy. Boots fast and the battery life is insane.
customer_reviews.author: Brian O'Leary

customer_reviews.title: No android Play store, but still decent
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some of the newer Chrome books, this one does appear to be getting the Android Play store which is unfortunate. Besides that its a pretty decent little laptop that I gave to my 5 year old for school work.
customer_reviews.author: Schroder

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I loveeeeee my chromebook!!! Light weight, fast, super cute. I only wish it had a disc drive of some sort and could allow me to utilize things outside google apps. but honestly all in all a great great great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Doss

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to use for those computer illiterate older folks.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for my 80 year old computer illiterate father. He doesn't need a computer per say, he just wanted to go on FB and other social sites. It gave him a bit of an issue resizing the fonts as they were tool small out of the box, but once he figured it out, he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: scot hansen

customer_reviews.title: A machine for the simple and unlock able potential
customer_reviews.text: Solid OS works the basics easily. It is possible to turn it into a Ubuntu machine but for basic users looking to browser and work with coding or text, music or even just apps in a simple way it is perfect lifetime of the battery worked beautifully. the matte white I got does attract dirt but I have been able to wipe off everything so far.
customer_reviews.author: James S Sotiroff

product_meta.title: Acer Chromebook13 CB5-311-T9B0 (13.3-inch Full HD, NVIDIA Tegra K1, 2GB)
product_meta.description:
Acer CB5-311-T9B0 Chrome book comes with these high level specs: NVIDIA Tegra K1 4-Plus-1 Quad Core ARM Cortex-A15 Mobile Processor up to 2.1GHz with third generation battery-saver core, Google Chrome Operating System, 13.3" Full HD Anti-Glare Widescreen LED-backlit Display, NVIDIA Kepler GPU with 192 NVIDIA CUDA cores, 2048MB DDR3L SDRAM Memory, 16GB Internal Storage, Secure Digital (SD) card reader (supports up to 64GB SDXC), 802.11AC Wi-Fi featuring MIMO technology (Dual-Band 2.4GHz and 5GHz), Bluetooth 4.0, Built-In HD Webcam, 2 - USB 3.0 Ports, 1 - HDMI Port, 4-Cell Lithium Ion Battery (48Whr), Up to 11-hours Battery Life, 3.31 lbs. | 1.5 kg (system unit only)

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: NVIDIA Tegra K1 Quad Core 2.1 GHz Processor

Can open/edit MS Office files using free embedded QuickOffice editor or Google Docs, and can download Microsoft Office Online (an online version of Microsoft Office) for free. Cannot install standard MS Office software.
16 GB Solid-State Drive (SSD); No CD or DVD drive
13.3-Inch Full HD Screen, NVIDIA Kepler GPU with 192 NVIDIA CUDA cores

specifications.Graphics Coprocessor: NVIDIA Kepler GPU with 192 NVIDIA CUDA cores
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars596 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
